hackathon-description-text: Hoya Hacks is Georgetown's premier hackathon. We are gathering 300 talented students for 36-hours this winter to build and innovate in both software and hardware, as part of a larger technological revolution at Georgetown.
hackathon-requirements: A link to a github is required.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Dell Venue 10 5000 Android Tablet, Amazon Fire Stick with Voice-Control remote, Prescription Coffee mug, $200 in DigitalOcean credit
Small Quadcopter, Sound-Activated LED T-Shirt, $150 in DigitalOcean credit.
Color-Changing LED Candles,Foldable, WaterProof Lightweight Keyboard, $100 in DigitalOcean credits.
R2D2 USB car charger, Floppy disk coasters.
Ultimate Arduino Starter Kit with Ethernet Connection

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: AABDP: Best innovation in Data Analytics
BAH: best Internet of Things hack
FiscalNote: Best use of FiscalNote API
Optum 360: Best potential to improve health
Twitter: most interesting use of Twitter APIs

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=37th St & O St, Washington, DC 20007, USA
hackathon-location-address: 37th St & O St, Washington, DC 20007, USA
hackathon-description-header: Come hack at Georgetown University! 36 hours to learn, collaborate, code, and innovate with fellow hackers.
hackathon-location-description: Georgetown University - Healy Family Student Center
